SENT.plain: Lower-extremity arterial occlusive disease in individuals younger than 50 years is rare
We report on 4 young adults with lower limb ischemia, each of them with a different cause
According to literature premature atherosclerosis is the most common cause and is followed by thromboangiitis obliterans, coagulation abnormalities and popliteal artery entrapment syndrome
We suggest a diagnostic concept which could help to avoid undue delay
